comments.comment: For the reason specified in the above comment,this line of code which the current comment is referrring to is removed. Hence closing the comment

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
Mohan Pattabhiramaswamy
comments.comment: After communicating with Maura and Carla, there was slight change in implementation of the Eligibility Override Pop-up. Earlier EligibilityResultType could be overridden for only MET and NOT MET status. But this resulted in a frame work generated information message when ever we were overriding Eligibility results of NOT KNOWN and PARTIALLY MET statuses. The workaround tried to prevent the information message getting displayed was not working for all the scenarios. So the implemenation was changed to include NOT KNOWN and PARTIALLY MET statuses as well after discussion with the stake holders. A FDP ticket has been created to prevent the information message from getting displayed for above case.Hence the the code for the current class has been changed and the line of code for which the comment is given is removed. Hence closing the comment

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Why is this not in a widget so it can be reused

comments.author: Mahendra Dash
comments.comment:
Hi Trevor,
This requirement has been evolving and we had been thinking of differnt solutuions as and when the req changed.
1. Earlier the requirement never had an option to update the status of the Evidence Result while reviewing the evidence. But now it is needed. So a new widget is added to manage the Evidence Result update part from within the Dynamic-Eform page.
2. We had thought of having an Entity to backup the Evidence data, but it came out that if we continue to have an entity to hold the info, then there will be many more evidence requiremnts in future and we have to have separate entity to hold those. Also there would be some redundant info spread in all these entities. We also had thought of the keeping a base entity and all entities for the the specific evidences will be extending from it, and this will help us design a truly dynamic form/page that holds the fields related to the evidence(s) being asked for or uploaded. The only thing we dint follow this route is it would have required more design time and cost as it involves some complexity.
3. We also had a thought of extracting the Evidence status part of it through a seprate Popup or Widget page that would show after the Simple Eform is submitted, so that we have a better UX experience. One with the Simple Eform is to capture the necessary data and the Other would be a separate one to hold the decision on the data. But that was ruled out by the team.
We can discuss these if needed.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: This is not in a widget since it is static data which is persisted as extra data. I will discuss the same with Ritesh and we will plan to document the deisgn decision in the design document.

comments.author: Hiren Rana
comments.comment: The deisgn outcome will updated. This is evolving and design document will be updated once the chnages for multiple document type has happened. Refer Jira ticket http://jira/browse/FAB-4525

comments.author: Sergio Torres
comments.comment:
The recomenders order for the modifiers is :
Access modifier (public / private / protected) abstract static final transient volatile default synchronized native strictfp
http://cr.openjdk.java.net/~alundblad/styleguide/index-v6.html#toc-modifiers
